name: Thai Chili Vinegar (Prik Nam Som)
description: An essential condiment in Thai cuisine that adds acidity and heat to brighten any dish.
recipeIngredient: 2-3  Thai chilies (or another spicy pepper of your choice)

recipeInstructions.text: Optional step: char the chilies and garlic by placing them on a dry skillet over medium high heat and stirring them around for a few minutes until charred spots form.
recipeInstructions.name: Optional step: char the chilies and garlic by placing them on a dry skillet over medium high heat and stirring them around for a few minutes until charred spots form.

recipeInstructions.text: Pound the chilies and garlic in a mortar and pestle into a paste, then add the vinegar and stir to mix. Alternatively blend all ingredients in a blender, though you may have to make a bit more for it to blend properly.
recipeInstructions.name: Pound the chilies and garlic in a mortar and pestle into a paste, then add the vinegar and stir to mix. Alternatively blend all ingredients in a blender, though you may have to make a bit more for it to blend properly.

recipeInstructions.text: Store in the fridge in a sealed container and it should last indefinitely.

review.reviewBody: This is a must for me when making pad see ew or rad na. So easy and becomes an integral part of the dish!

Can’t wait to have this with my noodles!
